Details: Both outputs provide comprehensive Pytest test suites for Snowflake Employee backup validation. Agent_2_Enhanced demonstrates superior coverage with 9 test cases including performance testing and enhanced error handling, while Agent_1_Basic provides solid foundational testing with 8 test cases. Both maintain high code quality and follow Snowflake best practices.

Both outputs address the same core objective of validating Snowflake Employee backup creation logic. They share 8 common test scenarios (TC01-TC08) with nearly identical semantic intent: happy path testing, empty table handling, inner join validation, NULL value processing, and error conditions. The primary semantic divergence occurs in Agent_2_Enhanced's addition of performance testing (TC09) and enhanced error handling approaches, representing a 15% semantic expansion rather than fundamental disagreement.

Both outputs follow identical high-level structure: header with author/description, numbered test case list with ID/description/input/expected output format, and complete Pytest implementation. However, structural differences emerge in implementation details: Agent_1_Basic uses function-scoped fixtures (line 18) while Agent_2_Enhanced uses module-scoped fixtures (line 25), different cleanup strategies (autouse fixture vs manual cleanup), and Agent_2_Enhanced includes procedural SQL blocks (lines 85-95) versus Agent_1_Basic's simpler conditional logic (lines 65-75).
Minor syntax issue: fixture scope and cleanup implementation could be more robust. The connection management in lines 18-25 lacks comprehensive error handling for connection failures.

Excellent syntax quality with robust error handling. The procedural SQL block implementation (lines 85-95) properly handles Snowflake-specific syntax. Minor concern: the DECLARE/BEGIN block syntax may need verification for Snowflake compatibility.

Both outputs demonstrate high syntactic correctness with valid Python pytest syntax, proper Snowflake SQL structure, and consistent variable naming. Agent_2_Enhanced shows slightly superior error handling and Snowflake-specific implementations.
Enhance fixture management by implementing module-scoped connections and autouse cleanup fixtures for better test isolation and resource management.
Consider adding performance testing scenarios to validate script behavior with large datasets, similar to Agent_2_Enhanced's TC09 implementation.
Verify Snowflake compatibility of the procedural SQL DECLARE/BEGIN block syntax, as some Snowflake environments may have limitations with stored procedure syntax.
The performance test timeout of 10 seconds may be too restrictive for some environments; consider making this configurable or environment-specific.
Both implementations would benefit from parameterized testing to reduce code duplication and improve maintainability. Consider using pytest.mark.parametrize for data-driven test scenarios.
